website_summaries.verdict: These metal bunk beds are cheaper than the competition but still sturdy.
pros: Higher weight limit than other metal-frame models (the limit for the top is 200 pounds and for the bottom is 225 pounds)
This bed doesn't squeak, and it takes up little space
cons: With a height of 61.5 inches, the bottom bunk can feel cramped

customer_reviews.title: Bad job at soldering in this bed.
customer_reviews.text: When I was a kid, we had a similar bunk bed. But nothing broke in like 8 years. This bed is made cheap, fast. Not safe. We put it together less than 24 hours ago and our son got a hold on the rail on top bunker and it broke. He hurt himself. Be aware. I'm very disappointed with this. And I looked at the other soldered parts/ joints, and it's poorly done.
customer_reviews.author: nadya

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: The bed is difficult to put together as the fixing screws can cross thread very easily. The center bar, on the bottom bunk, bends a lot even with a small amount of weight so I don't expect it to last very long with my two teens. One of the legs damaged the laminate floor. The bed was delivered with damage to the side bar which I only noticed after I had almost finished building it. The supplier refused to send a new side bar and asked for the whole bed to be repackaged and returned which I couldn't do because I had discarded all the packaging. I would not recommend this bed or the supplier!
customer_reviews.author: Brian J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Took me a few hours to put together by myself but everything fit together perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Blancarte

customer_reviews.title: bed for my grown boys
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bed for my 16 and 19 year old boys who still have to share a room. The full size on the bottom was an approvement for my 6'4" son to spread out a little. He can have the bigger size without it and another bed side by side taking up all their room space. Walmart had this same bed for the same price I got it but with it being a Prime item I got it delivered to my house in 2 days and didn't have to worry about getting it in my car. It is very heavy. Also was easy to assemble me and my 16 year old did it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed. Really sturdy. Not too squeaky. It's a little hard for my 5 year old to climb the ladder and over the railing on top.
customer_reviews.author: Dara L. Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy. Assembly took a while but it was not too difficult. Without good instructions the assembly could have been challenging. Follow the instructions carefully or you will be disassembling to fix it. I hope it withstands the use. UPDATE: Assembled a second one of these this past weekend. This one is great too. I was glad to have the hex tool they provided but an actual hex screwdriver made the assembly on the second one much easier. Follow instructions carefully to avoid assembling pieces backwards or upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this bunk bed. I was a little hesitant to order based on a few reviews. The bed arrived earlier than originally anticipated. It was well packaged. The directions were very clear, the items were clearly marked, and it was a fairly easy build. Lots of parts so it did take 2 hours from start to finish. Beautiful bright pink paint. Well made. Very sturdy. I would definitely order from the company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NICE LOOKING BED
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking bed. It takes awhile to put together so that is why only 4 stars. There are lots of bolts and screws etc and it is very time consuming. Not hard, just time consuming. My husband helped me put it together and it took us several hours. All the parts were there and it went together easily, just takes time. There is a large white sticker on the top head board. Not attractive, it says do not remove, but just gives instructions in several languages to not hang items from the railings. I did remove it, but it took another hour and a glue dissolving liquid to get it off.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the bed and would recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I managed to put this together in about 3 hours. We did have a problem with 2 of the lower bunk bars that go under the mattress but I called the company and they were very helpful in ordering a replacement parts. (Will take 5-10 days to receive). I read a lot of reviews which said that the frame sounded squeaky but we haven’t had any problem at all with that. I think the key is to not tighten the the screws as you do each one but instead at the end. Happy with the bed and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan L.

customer_reviews.title: the bed is really nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the bed is really nice and sturdy. Worst part was that several frame pieces came slightly bent, so they put up a fight during assembly. It worked out fine, but combine a few bent pieces with a few off-centered bolt holes...well, hammers were used, let's leave it at that.
customer_reviews.author: OhioPrimeMember

customer_reviews.title: Great price good product
customer_reviews.text: My kids love their bunk bed. Assembly took a little while but I'm a single mother and was able to put it together myself. It holds weight just fine. I've had all my neices and nephews over and it held up just fine. I have had a wooden bunk bed that didnt make any noise or wiggle at all but it's normal for a metal bunk bed and the price of the wooden one was double the cost of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I want a refund! This bed didn’t even last ...
customer_reviews.text: I want a refund! This bed didn’t even last a month with my 58 pound 7 year old. All I can figure is there was a weak weld. The bottom bunk bent almost to the floor. We had to support it with a weight!
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this is a VERY well made high quality product. We have owned many varieties of bunk beds over the years but this one is truly the best in terms of engineering (something I didn't expect from a multi-piece DIY item.) Considering the cost comparison after we went shopping at local retailers, this was a STEAL! One place (won't mention names) wanted $350 for a comparable product. This took approximately 3 hours to put together, and we had 4 people helping (to hold parts up.) You could put this together with two people, it would be difficult to get the horizontal pieces fixed without the help of another person.
customer_reviews.author: AwesomeSauce

customer_reviews.title: this thing is great. We wanted a wood frame
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is great. We wanted a wood frame, but they're pretty expensive in comparison. I also really wanted to have the larger mattress for the bottom for those nights where I end up in the kids' room. Assembly is straight-forward and I feel good about the "sturdiness" of this bed. It says the top bunk is limited to 200lbs, but it seemed like it could probably handle my 225lbs along with my 7-year old daughter's weight. I only hopped up there for a minute to see how sketchy it was, but FWIW, this thing seems pretty stable.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: SQUEAKY BUNK! BUY WITH RUBBER WASHERS
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these beds and THEY SQUEAK TERRIBLY!!! It kept me awake several nights in a row. However, I was able to solve the issue by completely disassembling the entire bunk and adding in rubber washers to each screw point. It was a pain in the butt, but now both beds are quiet and comfortable. Maybe a way to improve this product is to add rubber washers with the orders so that it can be assembled without the headache. Metal bunks squeak, but the rest of the design was decent.
customer_reviews.author: Nadja de Sa

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Really heavy to bring up into my apartment but my sister and I managed. It's pretty sturdy and perfect size for my small bedroom. I hope it last long! -------- Update: August 19th 2018 I still have this bunk bed and its still sturdy after over a year, me and my sister both weigh over 200lbs and we sleep at the bottom, my son who is 7 years old sleeps on the top. Definitely recommend this bunk bed, if you assemble it properly and tighten the screws good -- you shouldn't have a problem!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews before buying this bed. Most of my comments will agree with others. 1. The box IS heavy! We had to open the box and bring it upstairs in pieces. 2. It does take a few hours to put together. 3. The instructions are very clear and it was easy to put together. 4. It does not squeak. Maybe the others who had an issue didn’t tighten the screws good enough. 5. I liked that the “extra pieces” bags were actually labeled “extra” so I didn’t think I missed something. 6. You can do it by yourself but is definitely is easier with more than one. I am very happy with the bed!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Souders

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was fast and the package came nice and heavy
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for an affordable bunk-bed and this one always came out on top with top reviews but the price of this keep changing . I finally found the right price and went and got it. Shipping was fast and the package came nice and heavy :) . Assembly took me a while but everything fit perfectly and smooth given all the parts. My kid now enjoys the top bed and the small one loves the bottom .Will definitely tell my friends about it and would tell them to buy it from this company
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: great value!
customer_reviews.text: This bed was fairly easy to assemble. Just like any other piece of furniture I have put together. Very sturdy, which surprised me. I honestly wasn't expecting much with the $150 price point, but I was pleasantly surprised. For anyone wondering, you do not need a bunky board up top, and just placing the mattress on the bars works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Create2motivategifts.etsy

customer_reviews.title: Best bunkbed ever!
customer_reviews.text: Very very well put together bunkbed! Have had a few over the years when the kids were younger and none were as sturdy as this one! My youngest son is in his teens and always has friends over and they would take up his whole room with a cot/mattress. I decided to try and find a bunkbed that he could use as a couch when no one was over and extra sleeping space when they were. It really opened up his room! He is right at 180lbs and 5'11" and supports his weight fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L Worster

customer_reviews.title: WIsh the instructions were better!
customer_reviews.text: So the bed, now assembled after many hours, is what I expected. But please update the instructions to save others from making the mistakes I made. It doesn't tell you which side to put where for many of the parts, and I had to remove and switch the part more than once. For example, part T needs to have the holes to the back of the bed facing out. I didn't figure that out until I went to install the ladder and found out I had that part in the wrong way. I could give you four more examples like that. Please enhance the instructions to better clarify positioning of parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie M

customer_reviews.title: missing contents,  no apologies or quick resolution
customer_reviews.text: DHP Metal Bunk Bed Twin over futon Silver Part# B34402341701-10125-M production date Jun 12, 2017. The package deliv partialy opened and retaped missing "hardware pack" and item "X", also discovered a lot of "plastic" part which is a surprise. Amazon connected me to manufacturer spoke with jordyn who is unprofessional, unapologetic, did not give quick resolution, no compensation for the inconvenience, and avoided escalating to supervisor. I've done call centers over 12yrs as a teamlead there are always supervisors around. this is call avoidance, non-empathy and non-customer service oriented. I will also be filing a complaint to the BBB
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but the ladder is painful...
customer_reviews.text: A couple inches shorts than a standard bunk bed, which is super nice. The only downside we have found so far is that the ladder is super uncomfortable and a little painful on your feet to climb. Will need to put some foam on the ladder. Edited to add: It is now May 29, 2020 - the bed is holding up super well. No issues. We added padding to the steps as mentioned above. Added pictures of our DIY cushions. We used the skinny sized pool noodle and ended up only needing one. Then sewed some washable covers for them.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy assembly, quality bed!
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy when this bed arrived in perfect condition. We purchased a similar bed from Walmart and it arrived totally mangled. This is for my small children so it’s plenty sturdy for them. I’d be more concerned about the sturdiness over time if adults are sleeping on this bed. Assembly was surprisingly simple. You NEED two people for assembly and it only took us about an hour and a half. I would recommend this bed, it’s a great value for a bunk bed.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Robison

customer_reviews.title: Its beautiful :)
customer_reviews.text: Was very heavy to get box into house when arrived & lots of cardboard and wrapping around product I had to get off.. but what did I expect? It's a beautiful pink bunk bed though, seems sturdy. So far so good. Wasn't too difficult to put together just follow directions, it's pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly suitable bunk bed.
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for about a month and so far so good. I'd say the instructions were mostly easy, just pay attention in the first couple steps. It's hard to see but there's a small hole in 2 of the bars that need to be facing up. I didn't see it. Had to take it apart a bit to flip it. It's not noticeable until you get to another step later and it says to line it up to another bar. Otherwise it was pretty straight forward. And make sure your top bunk mattress isn't too thick.
customer_reviews.author: zamadylady

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old assembled this himself.
customer_reviews.text: We got the twin over twin. My kid couldn't wait to get this up and going, so we told him he was welcome to try and assemble it. Took him about 90 minutes. He said, "This is easy. Like doing lego's, but with bigger pieces." He didn't need help holding almost anything. All our pieces were there, and we even had a bag labeled "Extra" for some hardware. It's certainly not the metal bunk beds from my childhood that are indestructible. If my kids start playing jungle gym on the bars that go under the bed, they'd bend and break for sure. But if it's used, the way it's meant to be used, I'm hoping it lasts us a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Brown

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO SQUEAKY
customer_reviews.text: It seemed really great at first but after having it for four months it became so squeaky that every time my son rolled over at night it would wake him up. He ultimately started sleeping on the floor so now I have to get rid of it and buy him a new bed. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Moms can put it together!
customer_reviews.text: We waited about 2 months before reviewing. We have NO complaints. It's extremely sturdy, and was easy to assemble. I assembled it by myself (except one step where I had my 8 year old help hold up a part of the top bunk)... Since I was doing this myself, and had no one to hold up the bunk for an extended time, I ended up using zip ties to help secure the top bunk up in order to screw it on to the side frames. It worked well. My daughter frequently climbs it as she loves being on the top bunk. It's held up super well so far between her and her 3 siblings playing on it. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: J Moons

customer_reviews.title: Works out Great for both Parents & Kids
customer_reviews.text: My kid and I share a room and he has been asking for a bunk bed for a long time.I can't fit in a twin bed so I was happy to find this bed with a Twin at the top and a Full at the bottom. Box it comes in is long and heavy and its gonna take a while if 1 person alone does it but overall it's a good bed. Only reason I give it a 4 out of 5 is the strange plastic clips for support. Why not just make the bottom a mesh metal grid?
customer_reviews.author: Clos The Clown

customer_reviews.title: Frame buckling after 2 months....
customer_reviews.text: We've had this bed for 2 months. It was easy enough to put together. We liked it at first but after 2 months of our 2 young daughters (very petite and under 12) sleeping in it, the bottom frame is starting to buckle. They don't jump on it or play on, literally just sleep in it. Very unhappy how flimsy it is proving to be for the money spent. Save your money and buy a different bunk. Edit: I've contacted the company for assistance in the issues and have received no response. It has broken more and now my girls have no bed as this bed is a serious safety hazard. I WOULD not recommend this bed to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Family Love

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased this bed. It was easy to assemble and is sturdy! It holds a grown man easily on the top bunk. The stairs are a bit uncomfortable for grown people to climb, but I'm sure Kids would not have a problem. I would recommend this bed to anyone!#
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than average bunk beds, but works for us
customer_reviews.text: Even though this took almost an entire night to put together, I'm glad we chose this one. At first, I was frustrated because it is shorter than most bunk beds we've purchased in the past, but that ended up being a good thing. It doesn't move as much as the other set we have right now, and I think that has alot to do with the height. It also helped my niece get used to sleeping on the top bunk, as it wasn't as scary for her as her brothers taller top bunk. If the instructions were easier to understand, I would probably have rated it slightly higher.
customer_reviews.author: Kody Heskett

customer_reviews.title: Idk about this bed
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I came online for a bunk bed due to pricing at the furniture store but honestly with things like bunk beds you really shouldn’t go the cheap route for safety reasons no amount of money should be more Important thank safety I paid someone to assemble but I really don’t feel comfortable because the support is bars doesn’t screw in your simple push it in and my fair is the bed falling on top of my daughter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seemed difficult at first, but workes great
customer_reviews.text: And quickly realised we were making an error and once we fixed it it went up fairly easily. This was for our two girls, one is 10, the other 5 1/2, and this works so perfectly for them! The space save design is perfectly functional and works great. Our girls also share a room with their baby brother who is 7 1/2 months and in a crib, and this bunk bed fits in the room with the crib and room to move and doesnt feel to cramped! It's not a very big room either, typical apartment kids room, on the smaller side, yet this space saving design makes the room feel bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Do NoT but the silver bed, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on the silver bed, I purchased 2 beds one black and one silver. The black one I am very happy with, sturdy not super squeaky. The silver one however, I hate it, it squeaky like crazy and the bottom futon bends in the middle when you have it pulled out to sleep on it. Very disappointed and wish I had just ordered 2 black beds.
customer_reviews.author: D. G.

customer_reviews.title: Overwhelming at first but came together quickly!
customer_reviews.text: When I initially took all the pieces out...I was VERY overwhelmed. Im a single mom of 2 boys and not used to putting stuff together that comes in so many pieces. BUT the directions were SO clear, all parts were labeled, and all I needed was a Phillips head screwdriver (for only 2 screws). It comes with everything else you need including extra hardware parts. While it took me a couple hours on my own, the sense of pride and accomplishment upon assembly is insurmountable. The help line is there and it looks like they will immediately send you anything missing or damaged from a quick email. I’m sooooo satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi B

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!
customer_reviews.text: Pay very very close attention to which way the bars should be facing and which bolts you should be using! The assembly wasn’t horrible. We took our time but still have some difficulty that resulted in disassembly and reassembly. However, I’m very please with the quality! The bed is sturdy, made well and was packed very thoughtfully.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy B.

customer_reviews.title: Small space no problem!!! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great bunk for me my daughter and my husband. My husband weight is 250 and I weigh 125 the bed is very sturdy I have no problems with my bed wobbling. I went on the top bunk with my daughter and tested If it was stable it's perfect my daughter is about 35lb. The only concern I had was both ladders came with chipped spots, but I can put stickers over them great for small spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Set up is a pain
customer_reviews.text: Wow, we purchased 2 of these bunk beds. The quality between them is crazy. Actually setting the bed up can be difficult and time consuming. I noticed the screws tear up easily. One bed came with scratches and dents and the other looks perfect. It is sturdy and I like the gray color but the difference between the 2 and difficulty in setting up is why I didn’t like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once it was fully put together it seems pretty sturdy for the price
customer_reviews.text: The screws that came with are low quality and scared me the whole time I was assembling it. Once it was fully put together it seems pretty sturdy for the price. A few of the poles have dents in them, but since this is for my 2 and 5 year old I assume they will only create more in the future. The assembly was easy but very time consuming. This is a smaller bunk bed than I assumed but great for kids to maneuver in and out of.
customer_reviews.author: Trevis H.

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bed, looks very nice and it’s sturdy. My only issue was that darn warning sticker that comes on the top railing. It took me longer to remove it that it did to put the bed together. Even with goo gone, it was almost imposible to remove it. You can’t even read the warning because it’s wrapped around the railing. The bed itself is awesome and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Bed has gotten very creaky, weak bolt heads round out
customer_reviews.text: I initially assembled it a few weeks ago and that was a breeze. One of the top bars was damaged in shipping and bent, but I was able to bend it back and install everything. When I initially put it together it was very sturdy, However I discovered it wasn't assembled perfectly square so I loosened most of the bolts, squared it, and tightened it. Many of the allen bolt heads rounded out. I was able to tighten everything up as much as I could but now the bed is very creak when you lay down or shift your weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tova-Jesse

customer_reviews.title: So noisy! But sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This bed was affordable, simple to assemble and it's sturdy enough for my 2 and 4 year old boys. My husband and I can even lay with them on the top and bottom bunks, respectively, or he and I can lay together on the bottom and it's still nice and sturdy. BUT, and it's a big one, this bed is SO squeaky. I'm not sure how to prevent it but especially when you're laying on the top bunk, every little movement results in a squeak. I wish I had sprung for a more expensive wooden bed to avoid the noisiness of this one. If I find a solution, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: MrsH84

customer_reviews.title: Take your time assembling
customer_reviews.text: As others mentioned, it would be good to have an extra person with you to put this together. Note that they include some backup parts for the easily damaged plastic bits. But, be careful and pay attention to the directions. It's easy to get ahead of yourself and flip a part. Unlike some reviews, this will not fit a queen on the lower without forcing it and possibly damaging your bedding.
customer_reviews.author: autotkgrad

customer_reviews.title: A great buy! Worth it if you have the help.
customer_reviews.text: It was A LOT of work. The box comes with a lot of pieces, but it has great instructions with pictures that makes it easy. It says it takes two people to assemble but I had four. You need the extra hands to really get it together the right way. It is however very sturdy. I have two older teenagers (17 and 18) sleeping on the bunk bed and it’s tightly put together.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble and Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: My 12 and 9 year olds read the instructions and figured out to assemble the bed; it was that easy. I just functioned as the hired labor. Overall, it took us about an hour to put the bed together. The bed itself is rock solid and very sturdy. My daughters' only complaint was the height of the bed. They wish there was more space between the bottom and top bunks. Based on this, I recommend using a thinner mattress on the bottom bunk.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Inverso

customer_reviews.title: So wobbly
customer_reviews.text: This bed is nice looks nice but it’s so wobbly even with good assembly. I kinda feel like it won’t last. It took forever to build that at this point I don’t want to return it because I’d have to take it down again. I feel like this bed is not gonna last long and I just took a loss in buying this bed.
customer_reviews.author: ESTRELLA

customer_reviews.title: SQUEAKY SQUEAKY FLIMSY
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, SQUEAKY, SQUEAKY, SQUEAKY, This bed was flimsy and squeaky from day one, we have tried everything, from getting it to stop squeaking, pillows, stuffed animals, new bolts, sprays, removing, redoing, it's still flimsy, scary and did I mention squeaky,? My kids hate it, my 2nd son wont sleep on the top, he sleeps on the floor on a mattress, no guest will sleep on it, and IF ANYONE gets on it , the music begins, it's just an awful bed. Stay away for your sanity, now shopping for a new bed
customer_reviews.author: kelley

customer_reviews.title: as it came in what felt like a million pieces
customer_reviews.text: I must admit I was a bit skeptical as to the quality of a bed at such a low price, but I am pleasantly surprised. The bed was definitely a challenge to assemble, as it came in what felt like a million pieces. Each rod and bar had to be individually assembled. Once the bed was completely assembled, it is sturdy, looks great, and is exactly what we needed for the space we have. The futon goes from couch to bed and back in a simple transition. It does not come with mattresses (and shouldn't for the low price). My 10 year old son is loving his new bed.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the wood one.
customer_reviews.text: Just pay a few extra bucks for a wood frame. I tried to save money by going with this metal one, but it’s the squeakiest thing I’ve ever owned. My son can’t roll over without waking me up 2 bedrooms over. I gave it 4 a stars, because I’ve owned it for a year now, and I haven’t had any issues with it breaking, with a teen boy on bottom and my 9 Yr old and all his rambunctious friends playing around up top. The squeaks though!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Tranter

customer_reviews.title: My husband and nephew put this together pretty quickly and we are very impressed with the sturdiness ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and nephew put this together pretty quickly and we are very impressed with the sturdiness of the bed. Only a solid wood bunk bed will not shake so we are not concerned about slight shakiness when climbing into the top bunk. My husband said he could not feel the movement from the lower bunk anyways when we were trying it out.
customer_reviews.author: LazyLimaBean

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst item I have purchased through amazon. The husband and I spent a solid two hours putting this bed together.. not even TWENTY FOUR hours later the bottom bed bent in the middle. Do not buy this bed..such a waste or time and money! Now we have to dismantle it enough to get it out of the house to have someone from Amazon come pick it up... we will see how quick that will happen 🙄
customer_reviews.author: chelsie peschek

customer_reviews.title: Overall ok/good product.
customer_reviews.text: All as expected except allot of parts to put together. Allot of styrofoam mess. Bed squeaks. Kids have begun to pop out plastic pieces holding bars in place( 2,3,4 year olds). One pipe was bent a little. Took forever to fit that piece on. Will be buying braces for the corners. In time I predict it will get so wobbly it could break or strip the screws. On a good note: the finished product is beautiful and will serve its purpose for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and very sturdy... took me 4 hours to put together b/c of all the metal rods, but well worth the time. the next time if I moved won't take long to put back together again b/c all the rods already intact.. the top bunk kinna high up so be careful don't fall you could yourself bad, but during winter gonna be nice and warmer on the top b/c the heat rise.. I'm a grown man like using bunk beds, and I can use it as a couch(or bed) on the bottom bunk play video games... Tips: just like everything else don't over tighten the bolts
customer_reviews.author: Dogs25

customer_reviews.title: A sad nights sleep
customer_reviews.text: Very low quality product. Not worth the money. Cheap Chinese bolts strip upon installation and do not fit properly. Had to order replacement parts before I was half way through setting this thing up. I will NEVER buy another Dorel Home Products item again. Now stuck with a sad son for a few more days until parts arrive from Canada. Bolts are not metric nor standard size and cannot be purchased locally.
customer_reviews.author: Sally’s sht

customer_reviews.title: Torn between a 3 and 4
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically this bed is enjoyable for my daughters bedroom. However, like your usual metal frames the bolts aren't the most stable and my daughters aren't tiny so considering the taller frame and almost hitting our ceiling they aren't comfortable being on the top bunk. Also, it is a bit tricky to switch between couch and bed for the bottom frame. I was torn between a 3 or 4 star honestly. But I went with 4 star because my girls are so excited to have couches in their bedrooms. Also, the price for these beds were so much better than the wooden frame bunk beds.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Buy At Your Own Risk
customer_reviews.text: Box was delivered super jacked up,one of the parts were dented (for the lower bed) and there was a part missing for the upper bed. I wouldn't buy a frame offline again, but I do like the bed, and I love that my son loves the bed. Other than the missing and dented bits, it's not the worst thing ever. Edited: barely had it for a week and the mattress retainer (the handle that helps you pull the bottom bed into a seat) broke off in my hand. I shouldn't be sitting here thinking "what's next?!" when my child sleeps on the top bunk. Never buying from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Malanie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Box was huge, need 2 ppl to move it in the house but once inside and opened it was very easy to assemble.. it took me and hubby approximately an hour to assemble and the parts are all labeled with letters for easy recognition along with the bolts separated into sections. This all in all is a great product for the price I paid, and my kids are over 100 pounds each and there very sturdy beds.. I recommend these to anyone looking for a easy assembly and strong bed..:)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen .T.

customer_reviews.title: bed is weak
customer_reviews.text: i rarely write reviews but i had to for this bed! i am truly disappointed.....ive had this bed for about almost 3 months and i bought this bunk bed for my step kids and it was a total waste of money. You absolutely get what you pay for!!!! 2 days into having the bed, my fiance and i had to put wooden slabs under the bed to help support the original frame because all of the bars were super loose and wobbly. DO NOT RECCOMEND unless you're looking for something quick but not durable.
customer_reviews.author: indya

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken, manufacturer refused to send replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: One of the ladders arrived bent. I filled out the web form to get a replacement. It didn't work because it failed to recognize their own product number. I emailed customer service, providing all the information the on-line form requested. I got an email asking for all the information that I'd already provided, plus a copy of my receipt, picture of the bed, picture of the broken piece, picture of the white label,... you get the idea. Then the refused to send any replacement parts because I bought from a third party seller, though the product arrived sealed in its original packaging and the listing made no mention of them not being a certified seller.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyone
customer_reviews.text: My children love this bed. I have a 13 year old that’s almost 6ft n just can’t seem to stop growing. He loves his futon so much. My baby boy has always wanted a bunk bed so I was able to please both of them. Mr being a single parent I love to try and do things that are affordable fit me. This was inexpensive and quite easy to assemble. I had some difficulty but I think it was mostly me lol. I have no complaints about the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely

customer_reviews.title: mom and kiddo approved
customer_reviews.text: i bought this a few months ago and love it, even the price. worth every penny and was super easy to put together i deffinitley suggest 2 people to put together. my only issue is the latter loosens quite a bit so if you buy this keep the wrench for if that happens. my boys were almost 4 and 5 when i purchased this and its perfect even though they are daredevils they behave on the bed and have only jumped off once.
customer_reviews.author: amazonlover

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my step mom and dad to sleep on when we moved them into our home. Dad was sleeping on the floor for a few weeks after the transition and was dying of stage four cancer. He loved it. It took me hours to put together. Maybe 4 hours. I’ll admit I’m Slow but it’s very sturdy. A family of three sleeps on it now and have for the past 5 months! They love it. The top Is used for storage and the bottom Is left as a bed.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Bed for teens!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a bed for the teens! My son and foster son needed more room in their space. My husband unboxed and assembled this in under 3 hours. We bought an 8inch spring mattress for the bottom since it will be used for regular sleeping and a standard twin fit the top! The kids are happy and now when friends come they have a "couch" for gaming and hanging out! As far as durability, time will tell, BUT the box literally said "no horseplay"...so as long as they stick to that golden rule I think this will last their next 5 years in this house!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was not easy, took me 4 hours
customer_reviews.text: There were a few dents in the metal due to shipping. I noticed a few areas where the paint is already cracking. Assembly was not easy, took me 4 hours. This bed can be assembled so much easier that the booklet instructs. I assembled this myself but it would go much faster with two people. Slat frames could be assembled in their entirety, including the spacers, then attached to the bed. My problem being a short person, was the inability to reach the slats in the center to install the hooks after the bed was assembled. Do your self a favor and buy a folding allen wrench set. Bed seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: Great bed
customer_reviews.text: Bed came perfect only problem we had were the instructions...they were a lil backwards. After doing one step and going to the next we had to undo the last step to do the next step otherwise we couldn't get some pieces to fit. Other than that the bed is perfect. Didnt come with any scratches, dents or chipped paint. We got the blue and its beautiful. Lots of storage space under the bed!
customer_reviews.author: Caressa fink

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This has been a decent bunkbed has been very durable in mostly sturdy for the kids over the last few years the only downfall is it started squeaking and that has been annoying and we cannot figure out how to get this Wiecking to stop we’ve use WD-40 made the screws tighter but nothing seemed to work other than that we’re still using it today and just trying to ignore the squeaking sounds
customer_reviews.author: ladynla78

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: Let's just start with I'm missing screws for one ladder. The instructions weren't that great and the bed is not sturdy. I absolutely got what I paid for. We were unable to add screws to the top of one rail because it doesn't align well, luckily the other screws hold it up. The kids love it they don't care that its missing a ladder or that it wobbles. Hence my 3 stars. I highly recommend a bunky board for the bottom bed because the dip is serious.
customer_reviews.author: grisel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. Seems pretty sturdy for a metal bed once you get it together. The instructions could be a little clearer in some parts because we actually put the entire frame part together wrong before realizing that some of the parts were directional. Just pay close attention and make sure that all of your holes are on the correct side or facing the right direction before tightening the parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Cheeply manufactured
customer_reviews.text: Most of the parts are the wrong size, or they are dented/bent. 55lb child sleeping on the top bunk of it when we did manage to get it built, bent the bars dramatically after just one night. It would have been easier and more time efficient to bulid a bunk bad by hand from scratch using a blue print off google. Even if I had no build experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Okay, NOT STURDY
customer_reviews.text: Unless you plan on having this supported by a wall, it's not sturdy. My 8 year old (60 lbs) wobbles the hell out of it climbing on and off. Also, the mechanism to turn it into a bed on the bottom sucks and it's not really user friendly it's basically impossible for one person to fold it back up. We got a standard 8 inch futon mattress, nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsxa

customer_reviews.title: This is very well constructed and sturdy - something very important in my purchase and it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is very well constructed and sturdy - something very important in my purchase and it definitely came through. Glad my hubby put it together as it came in about a hundred pieces, but well worth it. It had to be cut in order to fit in our 7 foot ceiling rooms or else the top bunk would have been useless. The ladders on both ends are handy.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky but solid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 and 12 year old sons and they love it. It looks great put together and seems pretty sturdy for the price. Not the most solid bunk bed ever but not flimsy or cheap by any means. There was some trouble putting it together, fitting some pieces in and lining them up, etc but nothing major. It is a squeaky bed though and my sons have actually complained about the squeaking when they move at night. I wish there had been maybe plastic washers or something that could have helped prevent squeaking. Otherwise it's a decent bed at a good price and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mistelle

customer_reviews.title: Good instructions and easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Build time took me about an hour and a half and only one person. The box is extremely heavy and if you have stairs I would advise having two people to carry it. Overall, the build was very easy as the instructions are very clear. The frame is sturdy and included extra hardware just in case something went missing. The only complaint I would have is that the pin for the futon part would not align no matter what I did. tried like heck playing with the mounting brackets but it just will not align.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Niesen

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great value!  Sturdy and easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, sturdy and looks nice. Good price for a good bed frame. Got it for my two daughters so they don't have to sleep on the same mattress anymore now that they are older. Comes with Allen wrenches. Good buy! (Edit: I bought this for 153 dollars, it says original price is 400+.. I would not buy this for around that price, so I say the 153 is good value)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Taylor

customer_reviews.title: it was in great shape, no pieces missing
customer_reviews.text: Was difficult to put together, Could have just been because I had two little boys interrupting me.. but I had to take it apart and redo 3 or 4 times because I'd put it together wrong the first time.. Otherwise It arrived a day before it was supposed too... it was in great shape, no pieces missing, and it looks fantastic in their room... :) love how it looks.. just wish it hadn't been so complicated to put together
customer_reviews.author: Niq

customer_reviews.title: Good So Far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a spare bedroom and it has worked out well. My biggest worry at first was putting it all together. My wife and I are relatively handy and we had it together in a little over an hour. I have not had any issues but would suggest you look at description well for weight capacity before buying. We have not had any issues but i would have to say I wouldn't push the issue. It is well made and feels strong but it's not made of wood like traditional bunkbeds so please look through information carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this bed !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The color is perfect however this bunk bed is unsafe for my children due to the fact the support bar on the top bunk does not have holes drilled in to screw .I purchased this as a Christmas gift and my kids can not sleep in this bed .Although I sent a replacement part request to the manufacturer I have no ide when or if I will receive a replacement part.My kids were excited to receive this bunk bed unfortunately they can not sleep in this bed .Not to mention the box the bed arrived in was dusty and busted open on 1 side as if it was pulled from the dead stick area of a warehouse very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: It serves the purpose but to me not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The squeak, oh the squeak is awful!!! The bed moves back and fourth, worries me with my kids sleeping on it. The bottom is great, but not so sure about the top. I don't really recommend this item. The squeaking keeps everyone up at night. We've had it for almost 3 years now and it's not gotten any better. Even spraying wd40 doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Adam & Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great Guest Room Bed
customer_reviews.text: We set this up in our guest room and really love it. The bed is sturdy and was not difficult to put together... there are a lot of parts and it is time-consuming, but the directions are clear and the parts are all labelled well. The futon transforms from couch to bed much more easily than our old futon frame, and I've been impressed with the way that the mattress stays put on the frame in its couch-form without sliding off.
customer_reviews.author: N. Obert

customer_reviews.title: Huge Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has had this bed for a couple of years now, but she’s never been able to sleep on the top bunk. It’s incredibly noisy and shakes so bad. Nothing about this is sturdy. However, she stores toys and stuff on the top bunk, so it works fine for now. I was hoping that she could have sleepovers with it though. Kinda sad I spent so much money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Metal bends- not a long term investment
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bed for my teenage daughter in 2015, she weighs at most 100 pounds. After 3 years of use, we had to throw the bed away, due to warped and bent parts in the frame. It had several places we had chosen to duct tape it back together, but when the base under the bed became badly bent so that she was sleeping in a U shape, we had to give up. Over time, the bed also began squeeking when she rolled over, and that noise could be heard through the whole house during the night. Overall, it was a good bed for about a year, but not a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriele

customer_reviews.title: Quality of instructions?  Seriously lacking.
customer_reviews.text: It would have been nice if the tool they provided was an inch or two longer. My suggestion is a low volt screwdriver (battery powered maybe). By the time I finished my fingers were quite sore! INSTRUCTIONS: pay close attention to the small things in the pictures (no written instructions except for confirming the parts are all there and safety info to cover their butts.
customer_reviews.author: RoxBooLu

customer_reviews.title: Cool bunk!
customer_reviews.text: My kids sleep perfect in it! I have a 6 and 5 year old it's perfect and they will grow into it. Top bunk holds 225lbs and bottom holds 250lbs. Teenagers and adults can sleep in it. The bed is sturdy I've had it for maybe a month and a half and so far so good. Deff alot of pieces when it's mailed it's like anything else read the directions and take your time! Great for the price and an awesome space saver!!! Loveee it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed. Wasn't too awfully hard to put together
customer_reviews.text: Nice bed. Wasn't too awfully hard to put together. Definitely requires two people. Pretty sturdy. Nice price. Has accomodated both children and adults guests.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Woody

customer_reviews.title: Good so far except for the big white ugly glued on sticker
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, except; the gigantic big white cautionary sticker on the top rail of the bed (very visible and ugly and says in all caps 'DO NOT REMOVE') is extremely hard to get off and my husband is still working on it. That part is no bueno. I know it's a liability thing but it seems like it shouldn't be that impossible to get off, and it's not shown in your display pictures. This is for my young niece and nephew which are coming in this weekend and are very happy about bunk beds!
customer_reviews.author: ALC

customer_reviews.title: Cosmetic Damage
customer_reviews.text: We received the bed with many of the parts damaged. Unfortunately we needed it for our guest bedroom and didn’t have enough time to hassle with returning and ordering a new one. Assembled, the bed is fairly sturdy for the price. I wouldn’t recommend anyone more than about 80lbs sleeping on the top bunk. Super disappointed to have a new bed that is damaged seeing as the packaging was not damaged at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachaelrex

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, but tiring to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Pros: a. The cot is very sturdy b. The bottom full size provides very good support to the whole frame and has good space too. c. The railings and metal finish is very smooth. I dont have to worry about sharp edges. Cons: a. Extremely painful to assemble. It has screws which take atleast 5 hours to assemble (I did it by myself). b. Very heavy (on the other hand is indeed stable). c. One screw for the ladder was missing in the package. d. The instructions to put together is not clear. It can screw either which way, but there is only one correct way. I had to unscrew and put together again several sections. Its painful and tiresome.
customer_reviews.author: familyguy

customer_reviews.title: Overall great frame and worth the prise!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I’m going to be straight forward: it was a little bit of a pain to construct considering how many parts there are. However the finished product is a masterpiece. It looks and feels very sturdy. My mattress is quite think but I don’t feel scared of falling off the top bunk thanks to the high rails. Other than the amount of parts required to build it, I would 100% recommended and buy again if needed for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: Pvt. Ranieri

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly and don't feel too comfortable with it.
customer_reviews.text: Even with all screws on and tightened all the way, the bunk bed is a bit wobbly. It seems okay but I'm not too comfortable with it. I'll have to see how it holds up. I'm not thrilled with the plastic snaps holding the metal slats, I worry about them coming undone. I hope this holds up and doesn't come apart. My tiny one will have the bottom bed.
customer_reviews.author: D3M

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow a million pieces
customer_reviews.text: First of all, what everyone is saying about assembly is absolutely correct, it took a long time and was fairly obnoxious. Damaged parts are also common apparently, I had several dinged and dented pieces. Send them back you may say but I had the bunks delivered and then hauled them 3 hours north to my cottage, I’m not sending them back. As far as sturdiness goes, I had a bed like this when I was little and this seems a lot less substantial. I guess we’ll see how it holds up but I’m less than optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: AdamPA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 7 and 4 year old love this bed. They wanted to share a room, and a bunk bed was the best solution. The ladder is a little uncomfortable on bare feet but my daughter doesn't complain about it. The bed is sturdy, my husband and I have climbed into the top bunk many times. I read the reviews before buying and took everyone's advice of leaving the bolts VERY loose until the entire bed was put together. Putting it together was time consuming but totally do-able.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great price well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love this futon it definitely took longer than 2hours for us to assemble and the instructions were a little difficult but we got it done within 6hours with a break it looks good it's sturdy all the parts came in no missing peices or overly damaged peices although there was one or two metal peices that were slightly off shaped but not enough it wasn't functional i love it its exactly what i was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Briggette Munnis

customer_reviews.title: Too many bent parts...
customer_reviews.text: The bed frame came fairly quick but there was a lot of bent up parts. Bent up so much that some pieces didn’t fit on each other. I literally had to use channel locks to straighten out some pieces so I wouldn’t have to go through the trouble of returning it. The bunk bed also took a long time to put together because of all the tweaking some of the parts had to have to make them fit. All and all it’s a nice bunk bed for the price. My six year old loves it but then again he didn’t have to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: NellahTV

customer_reviews.title: This bed is sturdy safe and does not wiggle at all
customer_reviews.text: I received my boys bed a few days ago and have already put it up. This bed is sturdy safe and does not wiggle at all. Both of my boys 13 and 11 including myself put this bed together.. It is good quality for an affordable price. We love it!!! Thanks to the seller and Amazon..
customer_reviews.author: m. king

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Blue, Removable Loctite was used on the screws during assembly as metal bed frames will loosen up over time. This is a budget frame but well worth the $152 I paid. we added a couple Linenspa Hybrid Mattresses from Amazon and had a very comfortable bunk bed setup for less than $450. It looks nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gragg

customer_reviews.title: Took me about 4 hours to assemble by myself I kinda took my time so you could probably get it done in like 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: Update to my review: Had to replace the hinges once already and now I have to replace them again because they just recently broke again. It arrived a day earlier than expected. Took me about 4 hours to assemble by myself I kinda took my time so you could probably get it done in like 2 hours. The latch was a bent a little but it didn't affect it's functionality. It is stubborn when trying to convert it from bed to couch. I have to place my foot on the lower bar and lift it from the back to get it to convert
customer_reviews.author: christopher Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Probably not meant for anyone older than 10
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a 14 year old (bottom bunk) and a 9 year old. The bottom bunk does not hold up to the weight of a teenage boy. The metal started bending within 24 hours, and is now looking more like a bowl than a bed. If we could somehow return this, we would. Very cheap metal. This would probably work for smaller kids. Really needs to be a weight limit or age limit on this product because the full size bunk on the bottom implies that it could support a teenager or adult.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleU

customer_reviews.title: The threading on the screws stripped easily and so half way through building the bunk bed ...
customer_reviews.text: The threading on the screws stripped easily and so half way through building the bunk bed we could not tighten down certain screws or take them back out if we realized we put a piece on the wrong way. The bed was stuck half built with no way to take it apart without breaking it apart. We ended up having to order a second, different bunk bed. Also, the bed frame was super light weight, not sure if that’s a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tortimus
